Hey y'all!

I'm very happy to introduce `hordes`, a module that makes R available from NodeJS!

Repo: https://t.co/0lJgeV6w2D

Blogpost: https://t.co/qfiLgXj0s3

#RStats #NodeJS #RinProd https://t.co/sZNb3BFXBa

PROTIP: If you want to cite the #Rstats packages that you use in your analysis, and you should because developers put a lot of work into these things, just use the "citation()" function.

For example, to find the citation for the {pwr} package, you would write this ⤵️ https://t.co/0lH0rCcyCv

When I need to practice a new #rstats function (in this case, pivot_longer/pivot_wider) I use it in a few Stack Overflow answers

Like #tidytuesday, SO is good at providing a stream of novel challenges https://t.co/e1QrxHTIDO

modelscript: a (very) little @rstudio addin that will create a new R script for you, with a template for modelling tasks. Made it for myself while following along to @juliasilge 's excellent tidymodels tutorials, so thought I'd share. #rstats https://t.co/C4jB2184JR https://t.co/OGVRb6GMuK

👀 Slides from my talk at #eRum2020 about testing Shiny are available at https://t.co/ZXZhwpf3wo 👀
